resources.string: Click to see the most basic implementation using the HorizontalCentralizedList component to dynamically center items while filling the entire horizontal space.
CustomHorizontalCentralizedList to dynamically center items while filling the entire horizontal space using custom settings.
Click to see the implementation of the BottomNavigationCentralizedList component created to dynamically center items within a base component for a Bottom Navigation.

Here we have an example with the basic implementation using the HorizontalCentralizedList component to dynamically center items while filling the entire horizontal space.

In this case, a list is displayed that can have from 0 to 6 items (in this case, there are 5). Regardless of the quantity, the items will always be dynamically centered.

You can click on the buttons below to increase or decrease the number of items from 1 to 6, to see the possibilities of using the component.

Here are examples with some implementations using the CustomHorizontalCentralizedList component. For example, in the first case, there's a kind of dynamic level indicator that can be filled dynamically. There's a similar use case with trophies, another one with drops, and also effects like black and white and blur.

These lists can range from 0 to 6, but the code can be combined, for instance, with a RecyclerView to expand the list as needed. The items will always be dynamically centered.

You can click on the buttons below to switch between the examples.

Here we have examples with some implementations using the BottomNavigationCentralizedList component. For example, in the first case, a list with buttons containing an icon and a label at the top, a list of buttons with icons and labels at the bottom, a list of buttons with only icons, and a list with various buttons.

These lists can range from 0 to 6 and can be filled dynamically. The code is open and can be modified according to your needs.

You can click on the buttons below to switch between the examples.
